utterance.speaker: PETER GARBER
utterance.content: You got me. I give up.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh… she’s finally here.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Hello, I’m your new home operating system. My name is Lucy. What’s yours?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, my name is Rick. Castle. And … and … my wife just left me.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: Yikes. Sucks to be you, Rick.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM SINGH
utterance.content: Can’t you hit any harder than that?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I’ll take that as a yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, you can still back out. I can do this on my own.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Not a chance. I’d be dead if not for you, which means I owe you. Besides, I always wanted to be a digital investigator for the NYPD.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a real job, Vikram. You’ll be helping the Twelfth solve homicides.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: By day. By night I’ll wear a cape and track down the mysterious villain who sent a hit squad to kill us and scapegoat murdered Allison Hyde.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you take this seriously, please? I just blew out my marriage to go down this path.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Hell, I should be giving you the chance to back out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. If I don’t get justice for Rachel and for everyone else, no one will. We’ve just got to do this fast.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Fast is the speed we can’t move. We need stealth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If this takes any longer then Castle’s going to figure out what we’re doing.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: And if he does?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s going to step in. And he’s going to put himself in danger.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Then make sure he stays away.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Has Beckett told you anything about the breakup, yet?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not a word. You talk to Castle about it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. And I left him a bunch of messages.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shakes your faith. I guess nothing in life is permanent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell that to the victim.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh … hey. Captain Beckett. What brings you out into the field?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Work. What, do you think I’m going to be stuck in the office just because I’m Captain?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who’s our fugitive?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No ID yet, but the jumpsuit is standard issue at Rikers - but they say that none of the prisoners have gone missing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We had them lock down the facility, but a fourteen thousand inmate headcount is going to take some time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You run his prints?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. So far nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing? The guy’s a convicted felon. His fingerprints are on file.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Probably a glitch. You know those portable scanners. Sometimes they’re wonky.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there any chance that this wasn’t a homicide?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: None. It took brute force to puncture the victim’s body with that branch. Someone had to shove him on to it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how does an escaped convict from Rikers Island end up in the middle of Central Park without anyone seeing him?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It was late. Lividity puts the time of death between midnight and 2AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, keep running prints. I’m going to walk around and see what I can find.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hey. You didn’t call me back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah … yeah, sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh, that’s okay. But are you okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m fine. I’m just a little lost and … taking some space so I can figure things out. I just hope that I haven’t hurt him too much.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Girl, please. Castle is a grown-ass man and he knows that you love him very much. I’m sure he’s okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just – I don’t know what to do, Lucy.

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: I’ve compiled a list of top ranked divorce attorneys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I don’t want a divorce. I want my wife back. How do I do that?

utterance.speaker: LUCY
utterance.content: I don’t know. How’d you get her in the first place, Rick?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Has Beckett talked to you?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Give us a minute. You know better than to think I would betray her confidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Damn it, Lanie. Tell me. Why is Beckett keeping me in the dark?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The man who went Houdini for two months last year?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, I didn’t Houdini. I was Houdini’ed.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter. When you came back she accepted you without question, so you can damn well give her some space now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t lose her.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that from the Twelfth?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Escaped prisoner. Young, maybe 21? 22? Was that – iron fence?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Tree branch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ouch. Got an ID yet?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m not telling you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve seen this devil before.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Just … stop. Working murders is not your job anymore.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: He’s going to be an absolute wreck.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: And it’s our job not to let him spin out. That’s what the CDRK is for.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Castle Depression Rescue Kit.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Video games, Sumatran civet coffee beans, enhanced Blu-rays of the original Twilight Zone, and … this.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: 9-woof-woof?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh huh. Puppies at your doorstep in thirty minutes or less.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Puppies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good morning, my lovelies. Isn’t it great to be alive?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, are you feeling okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Never better. Because I know how to win Beckett back.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Is she wanting to be won back?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When we first met, it was my roguish charm that caused Beckett to drop her guard. But it was my Sherlockian skills that made her fall in love with me. I just have to solve a few cases with her to show her together we are still magic.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, you do know that you cannot just barge your way into the precinct and talk your way onto a case anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am a licensed private investigator. I don’t need a precinct to solve a case. Now, this tattoo was on the body of a dead convict found in Central Park. I know I’ve seen it somewhere before, but I just don’t know where.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so Rikers completed their headcount. All inmates are accounted for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So where’d the vic’s jumpsuit come from?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Costume shop. Our John Doe was not an inmate. He was a college student. Tattoo on his shoulder is the original mascot design of the Hudson U Red Devils. Now, I checked the college website. Peter Garber, 21 years old, majoring in marketing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But that doesn’t explain the jumpsuit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, it’s October. Halloween’s basically a month long party in college.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, the hallowed halls of academia. I remember them well.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: More like the hallowed halls of crackheads at my schools.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah … head over to Peter’s frat house, interview his roommates. I’m going to break the bad news to the dean.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Captain Beckett. I need to speak with Dean Feller, please.

utterance.speaker: DEAN CARLA FELLER
utterance.content: It would be nice to have a best-selling author on the faculty. Welcome to the Hudson family, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, please, Dean Feller, call me Professor Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Captain Beckett. Fancy seeing you here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I know what you’re doing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Giving back to the community by molding young minds?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re not joining this case.

utterance.speaker: FELLER
utterance.content: Aren’t you two married?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. We are. Dean Feller, meet Captain Beckett of the Twelfth Precinct.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. And husband and wife need a moment in private.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hold on –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah … it took me an hour to tie this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You saw the tattoo at the morgue, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I saw Lanie at the morgue. I can’t recall if I saw other things on bodies with gruesome chest wounds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me ask you, how large of a donation check did you write in order to become a professor?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guest professor. Look, I have no desire to interfere with your case, but I can’t help it if my path crosses with yours while I’m teaching here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I asked for time. Why can’t you give me that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because you need me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – I can’t do this right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate –

utterance.speaker: FELLER
utterance.content: I’m sorry to interrupt, but I really need to know why there are police on my campus.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A student of yours, Peter Garber, was found murdered in Central Park last night.

utterance.speaker: FELLER
utterance.content: That’s awful. He was a wonderful young man, a model student. He won this year’s fellowship award.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’ll need access to all of his files, as well as a discreet room to interview his teachers and friends.

utterance.speaker: FELLER
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And as for you – – Professor, this is a police investigation. Stay out of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s such a kidder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We got something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle’s here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He bought himself a Ph.D to get in on this case. You guys are not to work with him in any way, is that understood?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes. Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so what do we got?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A suspect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Peter was pledge master at the Beta Omega Rho fraternity house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me guess, he hazed someone and they threatened revenge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The opposite, actually. Scott Powell. Former Beta Omega. Scott terrorized a group of pledges, got one of them sent to the hospital, so Peter turned Scott in, got him booted from the frat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Well, that sounds like motive. Let’s bring him in for questioning.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, that might not be the right approach.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Scott’s dad is a defense attorney. When they tried to expel Scott, daddy threatened to sue.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Scott’s not going to talk to us.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unless … we can get him to talk without realizing that he’s talking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How … do you plan on doing that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So how’s the talent in your marketing class?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, solid. Especially this hot blonde named Jenny.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, for real?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, did you see that that frat boy got murdered last night in the park?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Heard he got impaled. Uh … what … Peter uh … something. What house was he in?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, bro. You know what frat the dead dude’s from?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT POWELL
utterance.content: No, officer, I sure don’t.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? We ain’t cops, man.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Dude, you look like you’re forty.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: B*tch, please. I got carded last week.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Yeah, for your AARP card. And your partner’s growing ear hair in front of my eyes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, funny man. We heard that you had a hate on for Peter Garber. So you want to tell us where you were last night?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: No, but you can call my lawyer. He’s going to get a real kick out of you guys. Have a nice day.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Oh, and remember: fiber’s your friend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t really have old man ear hair, do I?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, you didn’t really think you could Jump Street the prime suspect, did you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, I heard about the Scott Powell hazing incident and I thought maybe I could offer the NYPD my PI services.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Free of charge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, fine. I guess I’ll just use my newfound faculty privileges to talk to talk to Scott on my own. He’s got a contemporary lit class in forty five minutes and they have a very special guest speaker. A certain, ruggedly handsome, best-selling author.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He just might be the angle we need to get this guy Scott to talk.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett gave us a direct order.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Will she be more upset when she finds out Castle solved this case before us or when she finds out that we’ve been cooperating with him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perhaps my secret weapon is the loophole you’re looking for.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What secret weapon?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Anybody sitting there?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Uh, you are.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Yeah. Uh, I’m Scott.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Clara.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: So do you know anything about this Richard Castle guy?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A little. He’s an irreverent crime novelist with a carefree spirit and a hatred of exclamation points. Or so I hear.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Mmm. Well, I saw an interview with him a few years ago, he was trying way too hard to be cool.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m sure he’s mellowed with age.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “To die, to sleep. To sleep, perchance to dream.”

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Or not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Aye, there’s the rub. For in this sleep of death what dreams may come?” William Shakespeare. The Bard. A man as intimate with violence and murder as any in history. Who can tell me the classic motivations for murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You. In the printed non-ironic tee. Beside the too-friendly blonde.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. What might drive a person to murder?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: I don’t know. Revenge?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Revenge. A man wronged, his reputation besmirched, so he strikes out in passion. Some might consider his actions justified. What else might drive a person to kill?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Being forced to read one of your books?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Though that’s probably more of a motive for suicide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And, uh, what was the last book you read? Zen and the Art of Hazing Hipsters?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: No, I love how you come in here quoting Shakespeare like it’s just going to magically elevate that treadmill fiction you write.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Treadmill fict- Get out. Now!

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Works for me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: What the hell? First the cops try and front me and then that clown.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Cops?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: A guy from my old frat got killed last night. Peter Garber. They think I hated him because he got me kicked out for hazing some newbies, but I spent the last semester trying to make amends.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: With Peter?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Yeah. I told him I was sorry, you know, and he said we were cool. Even asked me for a favor. Said he needed a quiet place to study away from the frat house. I work at Residential Housing, so – – hooked him up with an empty apartment on the DL.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why didn’t you tell the cops?

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: My dad’s a lawyer. And he taught me, you never trust the police. Actually, you know, he also taught me that blondes are more fun. What say we go out later? My crew and I found this great bar called Jake’s –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’d love to, but I’m actually getting fitted for an iron lung in the morning. Bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Vikram, what’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I might have identified Allison Hyde’s killer. Pulled footage from the hotel’s cameras around the time Hyde was killed. Managed to ID everyone except this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, this doesn’t mean anything. There’s plenty of people who aren’t in our facial recognition database.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I didn’t just use ours. Snuck into the NSA, ran it through their top secret database. It’s a civil liberties nightmare, but very comprehensive. Our well-dressed man is a total ghost. So, unless you know a ghostbuster we’re out of luck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I might know somebody. He’s helped me out in the past. And he’s connected to this world. But he’s technically dead, which means you’re going to have to dig him up.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Just to be clear, you mean he faked his own death and now he’s hiding under a new identity that you need me to uncover.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Good. Because I’m not a huge fan of shoveling.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What are the odds Peter really wanted this apartment for studying?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’d say those odds are less than zero.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I thought Peter was majoring in marketing, not medieval torture.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This stuff isn’t for torture. It’s a BDSM dungeon.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What? I read 50 Shades and clearly, so had Peter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. I’m thinking this is a little less 50 Shades and more Fatal Attraction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Peter and his bondage curious lover set up shop here to fulfill all their kinky fantasies.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmm… role play. Perhaps convict and the wicked warden.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anyway, Peter tries to break it off. The lover, spurned – – flies into a murderous rage and then impales him in the park.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, we need to figure out who Peter’s been … entertaining here. That means we need to start knocking on some doors, pulling surveillance footage –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: There’s an easier way. Frat boys love to kiss and tell. If anyone knows who Peter was involved with, it’ll be his brothers.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but they weren’t exactly forthcoming when we interviewed the murder.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s because you’re “the man”. But I’m not.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He heard.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know this isn’t her first frat party, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You trying to make me feel better?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, it’s understandable if you’re feeling a little overprotective, right now, with what’s been happening with Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s happening is I’m getting her back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you sure this is the right way to do it? She was pretty clear that she did not want you working this case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Working cases together is why she fell in love with me. That’s why I’m going to do whatever it takes to solve this case.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Including sending your daughter into a house full of drunken frat boys dressed like a slutty angel?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Open it. Open it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So sad about Peter. Were you close with him?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He was a hottie. I bet he had a lot of girlfriends, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Hey, hey, hey. Her eyes are up here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What are you doing? I got this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you? Because I’m hearing a whole lot of flirting and zero fact-finding on who Peter was dating.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ew.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ew.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Old man? This old man is going to kick your ass. At beer pong. Beer pong challenge, everyone!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What exactly is your strategy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To get any man to confide in you, you must first earn this respect. To do that I need to bro down. Thank you. All right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ten bucks on Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Canvassing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Surveillance.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Surveillance.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Canvassing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In your face, Frankenstein!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We can explain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I ask one thing of you guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, all right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Terrible thing about Peter. Wish I would have gotten to know him better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You, uh … spoken to Julie? She must be devastated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn’t that Peter’s girlfriend’s name?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ohh, someone didn’t skip his lesson on subtext.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Drink.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, party’s over. Unless you want me to start checking IDs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was a nice shot. We should team up. We could pong hustle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, go home. You’re drunk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not drunk. Casing the crack. Crack – crack – cracking the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re a lightweight.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Come on, Dad. Time to go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, angel. You’re driving.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have a gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: It’s Vikram. I found your dead guy. Resurrected in New Jersey. And I know where you can find him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s been a long time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry to shake your snow globe, but you helped me once, when I was being framed for Vulcan Simmons’s murder, and I need your help again.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Forget it. I paid all my debts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This man killed an Assistant AG connected to Bracken’s dirty money scheme.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: I don’t know him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He works for Bracken’s partner. Some mystery man or woman deep inside the CIA.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Why can’t you just leave this alone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wasn’t built that way.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Look, I’ve got a good thing here. A woman who loves me, a new life. I’m happy. You could be, too. You just have to let it go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: What makes you think the drug shipments stopped with Vulcan Simmons’s death? Every narcotic has a signature, a fingerprint, if you will. You find his? Pick up the trail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SMITH
utterance.content: Don’t. You’re going to get yourself killed. Come on, boy.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah. You’re getting too old for drinking games, kiddo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was for the case.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: The one that Katherine keeps throwing you off of?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t win her love overnight the first time. I’m making progress.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Where are we on Peter’s faculty girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dr. Barbara Lillstrom, head of the psych department at Hudson U, top of her class at Harvard Med School. She was advising Peter’s senior thesis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And they had an illicit student-faculty relationship. One that ended ugly once he rejected her. Only I’m betting Peter was expecting a bad grade, not impalement.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I contacted the psych department. Lillstrom’s been out all week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She could be on the run.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: If she is, she didn’t run far. Or at least her phone didn’t. Her cell signal went dead yesterday but it last pinged off a tower outside of a tenantless building here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s four blocks away from where Peter was killed.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You know, if you want to curry favor with Katherine after last night’s little debacle you might tell her about this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, first we’ll confirm Lillstrom is there. Then we’ll call in the cavalry.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Times like this I wish you were more comfortable carrying a gun on your person, not just in your desk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A good PI relies on his wits first, bullets second.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: After your wits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That explains Peter’s prison jumpsuit.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Easy there, fella. Unless you’re a New York Yankee, quit trying to steal second base.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Watch your mouth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just saying, buy me a drink first.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Take this. Here, open four.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: I have to warn the warden.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What kind of prison is this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take a look around. Notice any similarities between the guards and the inmates?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wait, they are all my age.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. And I’m betting they’re all Hudson University students. They’re doing a reenactment of the Stanford Prison Experiment.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That thing from the 70s? Where they studied the psychological effects of making students pretend to be prisoners and guards?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Makes sense. Dr. Lillstrom is head of the psych department. Who else is going to have the kind of pull to put something like this together? Maybe Peter Shawshank'ed his way out of here.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Peter? He actually escaped?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know Peter?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: He was in your cell. But one day we woke up and he was just gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did the guard say?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: They freaked. How’d he get out of his cell? But we – we didn’t know if they were just messing with our heads, because that’s what they do here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did you volunteer for this?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: I needed the money. But now I just want to go home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. You mean, there’s no panic button? There’s no safety mechanism if you want to quit?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: There was a white flag but they removed it when Peter was demoted.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Peter was a guard before he was an inmate?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Head guard. Recruited by Warden Lillstrom. But he was nice to us. I think that’s why Lillstrom turned on him. She made Peter an inmate, forced him to sit in a chair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What chair are we talking about?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Our daily interrogations. We’re strapped to a chair. Lillstrom flashes images in our eyes, over and over. All these strange lights.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What does Lillstrom want to know?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Our secrets. The darker the better. It’s like she’s sliding around your brain, peeking into your soul.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Come open this cell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I give the grades. You saw my faculty ID. So here’s the pop quiz: failure to open this cell will cause an oh so disastrous end to your academic career. True or false?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey. Hers too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take us to Dr. Lillstrom. Right now.

utterance.speaker: BARBARA LILLSTROM
utterance.content: Damn right we do. Years of planning, of research, ruined! Do you have an idea of the damage you’ve caused?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ask me if I care. We’re here investigating Peter’s murder.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Peter’s dead?

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: Look, he broke out. That’s not my responsibility. New York’s a dangerous town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We know all about your relationship with Peter.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: I’m the advisor on his thesis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You advised him on a lot more than that. You were having an affair.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We found your little sex dungeon. And the messages you wrote on the mirror. Peter broke up with you, didn’t he? So you punished him the only way you knew how. By making him your prisoner. Then he escaped. Is that when you decided that he had to die, Doctor?

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: You killed Peter?

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: It’s not true. Any of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re coming with me.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You open those cells, but no one leaves here until I return with the police.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: Do not listen to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, and um … you’re indoors and it’s dark, so take off the sunglasses. You look stupid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yet another case closed courtesy of Richard Castle Investigations.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … who is this woman? And are you in handcuffs?

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: This man abducted me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not an abduction. It’s a citizen’s arrest. Please get it straight. Beckett, please meet Dr. Lillstrom. She was Peter’s teacher. With benefits. The real kinky kind, too. But when Peter ended their trysts she locked him up in a secret underground prison experiment. You’re welcome, honey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You went to an underground prison? Alone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not alone. I had Alexis with me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, well, since you had backup. Are you kidding, Castle? Your daughter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When you say it in that tone I sound like a bad parent. Regardless, Dr. Lillstrom is a suspect. Trust me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks. There’s protocol, you know that. If you had a lead you should’ve called us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, believe me, I wanted to. But they locked us up in a cell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I mean, you should have called us bef- wait, they locked you up? You know what? Never mind. I don’t want to know. Just go find Ryan and Espo and take them to the prison.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: That man is insane. I’m innocent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If he says you’re a suspect, then trust me. You are far from innocent. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right this way, guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh no. Oh no, no, no, no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I told them to stay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They’re not dogs, Castle. They’re college kids. What’d you expect?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This place has been completely cleared out. Dr. Lillstrom must have had a contingency plan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They took all the evidence. And I let it happen. All because I wanted to impress Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry, Beckett. I screwed up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I jeopardized the entire case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Again, yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you know what? If it wasn’t for you then we’d still be thinking that Peter’s prison uniform was a Halloween costume.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So I’ve been digging into Dr. Lillstrom. Did you know for the past decade she’s been contracting with the army working psy-ops?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. The Navy funded the first, the original, Stanford Prison Experiment. Maybe the Army is behind Dr. Lillstrom’s modern day incarnation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That would explain how the place was scrubbed so quickly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now why would the military be interested in a bunch of college students playing prison?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the government’s in need of new counter-terrorism techniques aimed at the millennial generation. How to get into the minds of young terrorists and break them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what better source of lab rats than the millennials here at home.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But we’ll never get those surveillance tapes back. So how do we prove that Lillstrom left the prison to kill Peter after he escaped?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need a confession.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the doc likes mind games, right?

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: Charge me or let me go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which sounds better, “negligent infliction of emotional distress” or “gross psychological abuse”?

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m writing an email to the Hud U faculty. I figured I’d let everyone know that you were conducting an unauthorized experiment with members of the student body secretly funded by the US military.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: I’d love to see you prove it. Especially because every participating student signs a non-disclosure agreement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Well then, I suppose you won’t mind if I send this.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: Wait! Wait. What will it take for you not to tell anyone at Hudson about this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The truth.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: Do I have your word, Captain?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hud U will never hear from me.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: Okay. I didn’t kill Peter and I wasn’t sleeping with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s all you’ve got? Well then, I’m sending it.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: Look, it’s the truth! The night Peter escaped I wasn’t even at the prison.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then where were you?

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: A pipe burst in my apartment. I was dealing with it all night. Check with my doorman. But if you’re thinking whoever was having an affair with Peter killed him? I might be able to help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now we’re talking.

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: My study deals with extracting secrets from unwilling subjects.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Peter revealed that he was having an affair? So who was he sleeping with?

utterance.speaker: LILLSTROM
utterance.content: Someone on that list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dean Feller, I’m sure you know why you’re here.

utterance.speaker: FELLER
utterance.content: Actually, I don’t.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we found the studio apartment.

utterance.speaker: FELLER
utterance.content: I don’t – I don’t know what that is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really? Because we showed your photo to the neighbors. They were able to tell us that –

utterance.speaker: FELLER
utterance.content: Okay. Look, Peter stood me up a couple of nights in a row. And I was hurt. So I wrote him a message.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Peter stood you up because he was trapped inside of Dr. Lillstrom’s prison experiment.

utterance.speaker: FELLER
utterance.content: What prison experiment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Peter told you about the hell that he was stuck in. Phone records show that you received a collect call from a pay phone near the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: FELLER
utterance.content: Yes, Peter called me. He was panicked. He told me to pick him up at the park and he would explain everything, but he never said anything about a prison. He never showed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Peter tell you that Dr. Lillstrom extracted the secret of your affair? Is that why you killed him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because he was the only one who could verify the truth?

utterance.speaker: FELLER
utterance.content: What? I didn’t kill Peter. I want a lawyer. Right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not buying this, are you? No confession, no smoking gun. It’s just … not clean.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s how homicides are sometimes. You know that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but something’s still bothering me. There’s a part of the mystery that hasn’t been solved yet. We’re missing part of the story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how do you suggest we find it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Same way we always do. We start at the beginning. Back at the prison.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You just want an excuse to get me alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Beckett, I just want the truth. What really happened to Peter that night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Peter was placed in this cell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then he escaped.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. But how? They said one morning he was just gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what are you thinking? How Peter escaped had something to do with who killed him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only one way to figure it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And guess what? We’re going to figure it out together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not going to get a signal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You trapped me in here on purpose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I didn’t. But since you brought it up, tell me. Why do you feel trapped in our marriage?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why did you leave?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s complicated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So is breaking out of a prison, so we’ve got some time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, we’re not having this conversation. I asked you for space and you literally lock me up in a jail cell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, whoa, whoa, whoa. Okay. Okay. You can – I’ll give you space. I’ll give you space.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, it would be just my luck it would ricochet and hit you and then I’d have two murders to contend with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, look. Relax. Peter broke out of here, so so can we. Probably.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right. I mean, we’ve been stuck in worse places together before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I like that word. Together. So what happened, Kate? What did I do wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, this one’s not about you. It’s on me. I love you. I always will.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then let’s work it out. Therapy. Counseling. Whatever it takes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – I just can’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huh what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Before this place was a prison cell it was an office building, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take a look up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I bet you that’s how Peter got out. Come on, Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, this is when you boost me up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … right. Ready?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re doing great, honey. Not to rush you, but …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Something’s not right here. How did Peter reach the vent from inside the cell?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was a two man job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was a two man job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Two prisoners escape but only one was missing. Which means –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The killer came back!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: – the killer came back!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll open the door.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks for coming down to the station, Emily. We just have a few questions about the prison experiment. And how you helped Peter escape from it.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, Peter reached through the bars and he hoisted you up and you both escaped. Didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And then you killed Peter in the park. And then returned to the prison. To your cell. The perfect alibi.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous. Why would I kill him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Emily, we know about the scholarship. You needed it to stay in school.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Yeah, but he won fair and square.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We know that’s not true. Peter won that scholarship because he was having an affair with the dean.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And then when you found out about it in the prison you took your revenge.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: It wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stop lying, Emily!

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: It wasn’t! It was a different me. That experiment messed with my head. After we escaped I just – snapped. It was so unfair. I had worked so hard, did everything right. When Peter ran into the park I went after him. Then I saw that tree branch. Why did I do that?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Thanks for meeting me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I finished piecing this together for our investigation.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: You’re having second thoughts, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
